heisig_chinese_memo: The chinese inch is an old Chinese measurement equal to a bit less that 1.33 English inches.  Since this is about a tenth of a foot we can say it's one drop of ten.
heisig_constituent: measurement, glue, drop, ten with a hook
heisig_story: This kanji actually stood for a small measurement used prior to the metric system, a bit over an inch in length, and from there acquired the sense of measurement. In the old system, it was one-tenth of a shaku (whose kanji we shall meet in frame 1151). The picture, appropriately, represents one drop of a ten (with a hook!).
koohiiStory1: The decimal system uses drops of ten as a measurement.
koohiiStory2: Glue two sticks together to make the best measurement. (I always remember the primitive, but never the original keyword.).

WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You want to measure something... something that will make you famous. You decide you'll measure the biggest mass in our solar system. We're talking about the sun („Åô„Çì).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself deciding to do this. First step is to get a ridiculously long measuring tape. Then, you go up to the sun and start measuring. You immediately start getting burned. Feel the pain of the heat from the sun. Think about how this really probably wasn't a good idea. You still go forward, though, doing your best to measure the sun. Ouch, ouch, ouch.

Basic explanation of words
Inch
c√πn
The Chinese municipal unit of length, one-tenth of a foot: size.
Short: an inch of earth. Cun Yin (the time it takes for the sun's shadow to move one inch). Inch heart. It's hard to move an inch.

Reading Mnemonic
You want to measure something... something that will make you famous. You decide you'll measure the biggest mass in our solar system. We're talking about the sun („Åô„Çì).
Imagine yourself deciding to do this. First step is to get a ridiculously long measuring tape. Then, you go up to the sun and start measuring. You immediately start getting burned. Feel the pain of the heat from the sun. Think about how this really probably wasn't a good idea. You still go forward, though, doing your best to measure the sun. Ouch, ouch, ouch.
